spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall room locations broadly follow the 2D plan (2 beds, living/dining central, kitchen+utility bottom, two toilets), but there are major deviations in openings and some dimensions. Doorways to decks and exterior glazing do not match the plan, and TOI-1 proportions are significantly distorted (render shows ~3' width vs 5' in plan). Window/door placement on exterior walls is notably inconsistent with the 2D drawing.

structural_fidelity.notes: Primary enclosure and internal partitions largely preserve adjacency (beds adjacent to living/dining; kitchen adjacent to utility; toilets positioned near their expected zones). However, the render introduces an additional exterior terrace/balcony mass and large curtain-wall style openings not indicated in plan (hallucinated elements). Wall thickness and door embedding look mostly consistent, but the TOI-1 size error is a structural/dimensional fidelity issue.

furniture_mapping.notes: Furniture types and general placement are mostly consistent (beds in bedrooms, sofa/coffee table in living, dining set in living/dining, kitchen counters). Minor mismatches in exact arrangement and scale relative to room boundaries are present (some furniture appears oversized/loose vs the tightness implied by the 2D plan).

aesthetic_quality.notes: Clean isometric presentation with good lighting and readable composition. Geometry is mostly crisp with consistent materials. Some visual choices (large floor-to-ceiling glazing and added exterior deck) look polished but reduce plan-faithfulness; minor projection/camera exaggeration exists but remains generally coherent.

detected_errors.description: Hallucinated exterior wooden terrace/balcony platform on the lower-left side of the 3D render that is not present in the 2D plan.
Window placement mismatch: the 3D render uses large floor-to-ceiling glazed openings on exterior walls (notably left/bottom exteriors) that are not indicated in the 2D plan.
TOI-1 proportion/dimension distortion: 2D plan shows TOI-1 as 5' x 8', while the 3D render labels/shapes it closer to ~3' x 8' (significant width reduction).
Deck access inconsistency: the 2D plan indicates deck access patterns that do not align with the 3D render’s apparent door/opening placement (left deck connection appears altered).
Some door swing/orientation cues (notably around toilet/passage areas) do not reliably match the 2D plan’s indicated door swing directions.
